title: Vabamu Museum of Occupations and Freedom
description: Estonia’s definitive memory-culture museum tracing occupation, resistance, and the restoration of independence, with an award-winning audio guide available in multiple languages (incl. RU/EN).
uniquenessReason: Focused on Estonia’s 20th‑century experiences under Soviet and Nazi regimes and the path to freedom—context you won’t get outside the Baltics.
bestTimeToVisit: Late morning to avoid groups; pair with Toompea hill walk.
seasonalNotes: Open winter; check for holiday closures.
matchReason: You’re drawn to rigorous, context‑rich sites of memory; Vabamu is the benchmark in Tallinn.

title: Kiek in de Kök Fortifications Museum + Bastion Passages
description: A 15th‑century artillery tower and 17th‑century underground bastion tunnels that defended Tallinn—now a multi‑tower museum with immersive passages and audio guides.
venue: Kiek in de Kök Fortifications Museum
uniquenessReason: Only in Tallinn can you walk original bastion tunnels beneath the Old Town and climb a late‑medieval artillery tower in one complex.
bestTimeToVisit: Early afternoon; tunnels are 7–10°C year‑round—bring layers.
seasonalNotes: Civil Defence exhibition runs through winter 2025/26; tours can be pre‑booked.
matchReason: Arms & fortifications and urban history in one; fits your interest in rigorous, tangible history.
